alert.note: Alert for Bibb; Houston; Jones; Monroe; Twiggs (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 31 at 8:10PM EST until January 03 at 11:17PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Jones, Houston, Bibb, Monroe and Twiggs Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Ocmulgee River near Macon. * WHEN...Until late Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 20 feet, minor flooding expands with an increasing amount of the Macon GreenWay Ocmulgee Heritage Trail flooded north of the Martin Luther King Boulevard bridge. The flood waters will be around one foot deep on portions of the trail and both banks will overflow upstream from the bridge. Large portions of agricultural lands well downstream will be under one to three feet of water. At 21 feet, minor flooding expands with even more of the Macon GreenWay Ocmulgee Heritage Trail flooded north of the Martin Luther King Boulevard bridge. The flood waters will be up to two feet deep on portions of the trail and both banks will overflow upstream from the bridge. Large portions of agricultural lands east of Macon and well downstream will be under 1 to 4 feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM EST Friday the stage was 19.9 feet, and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.8 feet Saturday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
